headline.main: MEXICO ACCEPTS FORMULA; Approves Uruguayan Proposal on American States' Belligerency

New U.S. Envoy in Uruguay MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 12 WP)-William Dawson of Minne- sota presented his credentials to- day to President Alfredo. Baldomir. as the first "United States Anibas- Lsador to Uruguay, where the United States formerly was repre- sented by a Minister. Mr. Dawson had served as Minister here. He was Ambassador to Panama at .the time of his appointment to the Am- bassadorial post here.

docs.snippet: ANN ARBOR, Mich., July 12 -- "A proposal to men of good-will for educational reconstruction after the war," which was described here as the first organized challenge to Hitlerism in the field of education, was presented today to the international...
docs.lead_paragraph: ANN ARBOR, Mich., July 12 -- "A proposal to men of good-will for educational reconstruction after the war," which was described here as the first organized challenge to Hitlerism in the field of education, was presented today to the international conference of the New Educational Fellowship by a committee of twenty educators of six countries, headed by Dr. William H. Kilpatrick of Teachers College, Columbia University.
docs.abstract: Post-war econ and educ conditions discussed at New Educ Fellowship meeting

headline.main: EDUCATORS FRAME POST-WAR ERA PLAN; Proposals Submitted to New Fellowship Offer Challenge to 'Disease' of Hitlerism NOT SCHOOLING ALONE' Report Says Reconstruction Must Enter Into All Phases of Living to Avert New Collapse

byline.original: By W.A. MACDONALDSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Thirty-three persons were Indicted in Brooklyn yesterday on charges of cooperating with the German Government to violate the espionage laws of this country. One defendant pleaded guilty yesterday. The others will be arraigned in Federal Court on...
docs.lead_paragraph: Thirty-three persons were Indicted in Brooklyn yesterday on charges of cooperating with the German Government to violate the espionage laws of this country. One defendant pleaded guilty yesterday. The others will be arraigned in Federal Court on Friday and the trial has been tentatively set for September.
docs.abstract: 33 indicted by grand jury on charges of cooperating with German Govt to violate U S espionage laws; list; 37 others named as co-conspirators; H M Kennedy on technique used; Clausing pleads guilty

headline.main: 33 INDICTED HERE AS A SPY NETWORK OPERATED BY REICH; Brooklyn Grand Jury Names Germany as Conspirator in 39-Page True Bill

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 18 -- The blacklist against 1,800 Latin-American firms and individuals believed to be acting in the interest of Germany and Italy will be extended in a few weeks or months to entities of the same character in countries outside the...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 18 -- The blacklist against 1,800 Latin-American firms and individuals believed to be acting in the interest of Germany and Italy will be extended in a few weeks or months to entities of the same character in countries outside the Western Hemisphere, except in the British Commonwealth of Nations, under a procedure announced today by Dean Acheson, Assistant Secretary of State.
docs.abstract: On plans to extend Latin-Amer blacklist

headline.main: Trade Blacklist Will Be Extended To Axis Links in Japan and Europe; Acheson Stresses Severing of Ties Without Injury to Nation's 'Overall' Commerce -- Nazi Press Bitter in Comment EXTENDS BLACKLIST TO JAPAN, EUROPE

byline.original: By BERTRAM D. HULENSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: THESE differences between the people of these different worlds, the ways of the Argentines, the Chileans, the Brazilians and the others, "what they eat, think and propose to do . . . what sort of men rule over them . . . whether they plan to play...
docs.lead_paragraph: THESE differences between the people of these different worlds, the ways of the Argentines, the Chileans, the Brazilians and the others, "what they eat, think and propose to do . . . what sort of men rule over them . . . whether they plan to play with us or with the foe . . . if and when that foe appears," that is what Hubert Herring has written about.

headline.main: The World of the Twenty Republics to the South; Hubert Herring's Excellent Panorama of Our Neighbors and Our Relations With Them GOOD NEIGHBORS. By Hubert Herring. With maps, ix + 351 pp. New Haven: Yale Univer- sity Press. $3. Twenty Republics to the South

docs.snippet: CHEYENNE, Wyo. -- Got the smell of the powder snow from the slopes above Paradise Valley in your nostrils, or the yearning for barking leather in your heart? Most Americans do about the middle of July, but it is only an inherited instinct -- a malady...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHEYENNE, Wyo. -- Got the smell of the powder snow from the slopes above Paradise Valley in your nostrils, or the yearning for barking leather in your heart? Most Americans do about the middle of July, but it is only an inherited instinct -- a malady the West can cure.
